# autoplayLooped

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the audio should play in a loop when the node is added to the scene.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var autoplayLooped: Bool { get set }
```

```swift
var autoplayLooped: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If the property value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], then the audio starts playing as soon as the node is added to the scene, and repeats after it completes. If [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], then the audio node’s content never plays automatically. It must be explicitly scheduled using the scene’s audio engine. The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

## Configuring Audio Nodes

- **avAudioNode**: The audio node’s current audio asset.
- **isPositional**: A Boolean property that indicates whether the node’s audio is altered based on the position of the node.
